headline.main: Protein That Lowers Heart Risk Tied to Moderate Drinking and Exercise; Precise Measurements Important

byline.original: By JANE E. BRODY Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: Study financed by National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute links physical activity to high levels of HDL, a blood protein, that protects against heart disease (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: BETHESDA, Md., Nov. 12--A study of nearly 10,000 people in the United States and Canada has confirmed that moderate alcohol consumption and physical activity, among other factors, are linked to high levels of a blood protein that protects against heart disease.

headline.main: PROTEIN THAT LOWERS HEART RISK TIED TO MODERATE DRINKING AND EXERCISE

docs.lead_paragraph: A study of nearly 10,000 people in the United States and Canada has confirmed that moderate alcohol consumption and physical activity, among other factors, are linked to high levels of a blood protein that protects against heart disease. At the same time, the study, the first of its kind, showed that cigarette smoking and obesity were associated with significantly lower levels of this protein, which binds to cholesterol in the blood and transports it.
docs.snippet: A study of nearly 10,000 people in the United States and Canada has confirmed that moderate alcohol consumption and physical activity, among other factors, are linked to high levels of a blood protein that protects against heart disease.         At...

headline.main: Couples Prove Two Can Diet Better Than One; Scores of Diets Fail Husbands' Helping Hand Weight Loss Is 76 Pounds

docs.abstract: Article on couples who have have achieved weight loss after teaming up to change their eating habits; recent studies support theory that behavior modification techniques are more effective when partnership system is involved; some dieters comment; illustrations (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: They are thinner now than on their wedding day and together they grow happier and younger-looking with each passing pound.
docs.snippet: They are thinner now than on their wedding day and together they grow happier and younger-looking with each passing pound.
